frame.name: Becoming_silent
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame a <fen>Speaker</fen> ceases speaking, sometimes about a particular <fen>Topic</fen>. An <fen>Expressor</fen> may also be indicated. <ex></ex> The words of this frame are very frequently used imperatively, to the extent that certain words and phrases (<ment>not another word, silence, shhh</ment>) can only be used this way.
<ex>Finally, <fex name="Speaker">Jan</fex> <t>shut</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="Topic">about his car accident</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Expressor">The children's laughter</fex> <t>quieted</t> <t>down</t>.</ex> <ex>Somehow, <fex name="Speaker">he</fex> managed to <t>hold</t> <fex name="Speaker">his</fex> <t>tongue</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> has previously been speaking but has now stopped. <ex><fex name="Speaker">The children</fex> finally <t>quieted</t> <t>down</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject which the <fen>Speaker</fen> had been speaking about. <ex>Mark <t>shut</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="Topic">about the book</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the becoming silent occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the becoming silent occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s voice or other communicative noise emitted by the <fen>Speaker</fen>. <ex><fex name="Expressor">The excited chatter</fex> <t>hushed</t>.</ex></def-root >

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The manner in which the quietening occurs. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.</def-root>
